text.tspan: One of: Firefox 2.0, Chrome 1, Opera 9, Safari 3
One of: Firefox 2.0, Internet Explorer 7, Safari 3, Opera 9, Google Chrome 1
day free trial and pricing plans that work out to be just a few dollars per student depending
on how many students will use it per year.
Students enroll in their teacher's class and can create comics either independently or for an
assignment set up by their teacher. They select the layout of their comic, and then begin to add
people, backgrounds, speech bubbles, and other items. Ev
erything that is added can be
manipulated in almost endless ways. Any characters added can be modified to be in any
position, have any facial expression etc. The program even allows you to import your own
images or backgrounds for your comic book. The teac
her is able to monitor the progress of
each of their students' comic book as well.
There are no games included, but creating the comic book can be a fun activity in and of itself.
te a scene from a book being read.
b. Have students create a comic strip of a historic event.
c. Students can create a comic book to detail the procedure of a science experiment.
d. Students can write their comics in a foreign language to display their kno
Ability to maintain classes and assign projects within Pixton
tudents as they create their projects
